activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curt R. Smallish

records.addlTxt:
2:51 PM Defendant Grayson J. Saari in court. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Grayson J. Saari. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Bennett states he beleives there will be a resolution - would like to set out - if victim paid - case will be dismissed. Bond Continued. adj. 02:52 PM
Status conference scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 03:30 pm.

2:34 PM Defendant Curt R. Smallish in court.  Attorney Timothy B Melms in court for Curt R. Smallish.  Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Calling 22cf98 and 22cf107.
Melms statement  - offer made but not yet accepted - ongoing negotiations.  Sowinski statement,
Bail continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:14 AM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Curt R. Smallish in court.  Attorney Timothy B Melms in court for Curt R. Smallish. 
Calling 22cf98 and 22cf107.
Defendant waives preliminary hearings. Waivers free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Pfeifer states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Melms willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. 
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
2:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Curt R. Smallish in court. Attorney Maggie Hogan appearing specially for Timothy B Melms in court for Curt R. Smallish. Victim is not present. Calling 22CF98 & 22CF107. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived. Bail continued. adj. 02:39 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Curt R. Smallish in court. Victim is appearing telephonically. Calling 22CF98 & 22CF107. Court review of cases. Court questions Defendant on counsel. Defendant states does not qualify for PD - trying to obtain private counsel - needs to get tax return back. Court will set out. Victim makes statement. Bond continued. adj. 03:08 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Curt R. Smallish appeared by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Defendant states going to hire private counsel. Pfeifer statement to bail; will be transferred to Branch 2. Court sets bond. Defendant statement to bond/charges. adj. 02:06 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
